jobs.jobTitle: Client Enterprise Account Manager - Federal Government
jobs.description:
Veeam® recognizes the new challenges companies across the globe face in enabling the Always-On Enterprise™, a business that must operate 24/7/365. To address this, Veeam has pioneered a new market of Availability for the Always-On Enterprise™ by helping organizations meet recovery time and point objectives (RTPO™) of less than 15 minutes for all applications and data, through a fundamentally new kind of solution that delivers high-speed recovery, data loss avoidance, verified recoverability, leveraged data and complete visibility. Veeam Availability Suite™, which includes Veeam Backup & Replication™, leverages virtualization, storage, and cloud technologies that enable the modern data center to help organizations save time, mitigate risks, and dramatically reduce capital and operational costs, while always supporting the current and future business goals of Veeam customers.
 
Founded in 2006, Veeam currently has 51,000+ ProPartners and more than 267,500+ customers worldwide. Veeam's global headquarters are located in Baar, Switzerland, and the company has offices throughout the world.

Steven is a senior technology industry leader who lives and breathes client success through the application of technology. He believes high calibre, motivated people who focus on helping clients achieve their outcomes are the ones who achieve the most.

Before taking on the role of Managing Director, Microsoft Australia, Steven was Director of Microsoft's Enterprise and Partner Group, where he brought together business know-how, technology and people to deliver innovative solutions for Australia’s largest companies.

He is now responsible for Microsoft’s overall business in Australia, ensuring the company meets the needs of all its customers and the 11,000 plus partners who sell or build on the Microsoft platform.

Steven lives in Sydney with his wife and three children.  He is passionate about being on or in the water, and in helping to create stronger communities in Sydney and around Australia.

general.description:
Leading a team of 100+ talented marketing & operations professionals across Microsoft Australia, my focus is empowering them to transform our customer experiences through data-driven digital capabilities. 

Over my 20 + years of career at Microsoft, I have held several roles in marketing and leadership in US and Australia with an uncompromising focus on delighting customers and delivering business results.

More than ever, I am inspired by our focus at Microsoft to help businesses go through their own digital transformation. That is to become more engaged with their customers, empower their employees, optimise how they run their business operations and transforming the products and services they offer using digital content.

I am super passionate about the marketing profession and the important role we play in leadership and business.

Keeping this mission at the heart of everything I do, as the CMO and COO of Microsoft Australia, I am committed to develop and execute modern marketing strategies across the full range of our products and services in Australia and elevate the way we service our customers and partners.

general.headline: Entrepreneurial Executive ★ Director ICT (Telstra) ★ Expert in transforming business for go-to-market strategy
general.description:
As a Member of the Telstra Executive Team, I have played an integral role in driving forward strategic alliances and transforming the business go-to-market strategy. 

With an 18 year career within the ICT space and 15 years in a leadership capacity, I have earned a solid reputation for crafting a vision and culture that steers customer engagement and which has been instrumental driving in customer growth and improvement. I am also known for mitigating risk and strategizing to turn around declining results.

Steve Jobs said it best when he stated that 'The ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world are the ones who do.' As a Director who harnesses an entrepreneurial approach to influence growth and drive change, I have been honoured to lead outstanding teams where we have collectively driven further momentum within Telstra's business and been ‘crazy enough’ to change Telstra’s footprint in a global context.

I own a passion for mentoring and coaching teams and feel a deep satisfaction when I inspire others to be the best they can be. As a Director whose leadership values include team engagement, I believe this has been pivotal in steering new, billion-dollar initiatives.

Considered 'Top Talent' in Telstra and one who is optimistic, results and people driven, I am known for my authenticity, agility, propensity to innovate, and high level skill in investing in partners.

Specialties: 
✔ Setting strategic direction
✔ Overseeing revenues, profits and expenditure
✔ Creating business excellence

Key to this is my ability to recruit partners, leverage relationships, and consult with leaders in their respective industry - including on the ground in various locations around the world such as Singapore, Hong Kong, London, Europe and the US.

Leading a global team of 250, we have realised significant benefits and success, including:

✔ Currently experiencing growth of 309% YoY

general.headline: Senior Technology & Digital Transformation Executive
general.description:
A passionate Technology Executive with a background in Software Engineering and leadership in; Product, Digital Transformation, Professional Services, Sales and Operations. My passion is to help businesses adapt and transform, embrace Technology, develop talent, connect strategy to results, forge strong partnerships and create new pathways for growth. 

At Telstra, I led the creation of the Business Technology Services group, driving growth organically and through multiple acquisitions to create a 3000+ FTE Professional Services business.  I also led Telstra's Global Enterprise Product group, transforming how Telstra builds technology products, and creating the next generation of capability in areas such as Software Defined Networking, IoT, Cloud, Cyber Security and Digital products. My team spanned Australia, Asia, Europe and North America.

Prior to Telstra, I enjoyed a 14-year career at IBM, including senior executive roles in Sales, Services, Operations and Business Process Outsourcing, across IBM’s many Divisions including Technology Services, Outsourcing, Consulting, Software and Infrastructure.  In my last role at IBM, I led IBM's Australia and New Zealand BPO business, with staff located across multiple geographies globally.  

My early career focused on Software Engineering.

I live in Melbourne with my husband Cameron, and our two sons.

The team had specialist capabilities in Network Services, Collaboration, Cyber Security, Cloud, Digital and Transformation Services.  The hyper-growth was achieved through both organic and inorganic means, including 6 successful acquisitions, all of which exceeded their business cases, and helped Telstra grow faster than the market & embrace emerging technologies.

general.description:
⭐️ Tap [...] and hit 'FOLLOW' 👆🏼

Disclaimer: I cannot stand bio's written in third person but I also cannot be bothered re-writing this bio that was written for me for a conference, so let's do this:

“Gretta van Riel is one of Australia’s top young serial entrepreneurs. 

With 5 multi-million dollar startups under her belt, Gretta prides herself on turning audiences into brands and trends into markets. 

She loves to hack a social media algorithm with over 16 million followers on Instagram, over 5.8M impressions a month on Pinterest and 2.6M views of her content on LinkedIn in 10 days. She once grew an Instagram account from 0-48,500 followers in a day. 

Gretta founded her first startup, SkinnyMe Tea (SMT), at the age of 22 with $24 in the bank. SMT went on to be a global success going on to win the Shopify Build-A-Business competition in 2013. Five years on, SMT has now  sold over 11 million cups of tea worldwide and helped their customers lose a combined 1.5M kgs.

Gretta later went on to co-create The 5TH Watches (www.the5th.co), which achieved over $100k in revenue on it’s first day of sales, and $1M in a single day of sales. Gretta exited The 5TH in late 2017.

More recently, Gretta has shifted her focus from eComm to tech. 

Leveraging her extensive knowledge of the influencer marketing landscape as both a brand and an influencer Gretta launched her Influencer Marketing platform − Hey Influencers. 

Hey Influencers is an Influencer Relationship Management (IRM) and campaign creation platform helping to connect and cultivate relationships between brands and social media influencers.”

general.headline: Founder & Editor in Chief at Collective Hub
general.description:
Lisa Messenger is the vibrant, game-changing CEO of The Messenger Group, as well as founder and editor-in-chief of Collective Hub – a multi-platform entrepreneurial lifestyle destination with a mandate to disrupt, challenge and inspire. In addition, she has worked globally in events, sponsorship, marketing, PR and publishing. 

Lisa launched The Messenger Group in 2001, which has since custom published more than 400 books for companies and individuals. Lisa has authored and co-authored 16 books and become an authority in the start-up scene.  

Most notably, Lisa charted her rollercoaster ride to success in best-selling book Daring & Disruptive and its sequel Life & Love, which reached #1 on Booktopia.  Lisa’s next book, Money and Mindfulness was released late in 2015 and also hit best-selling status within the first month. In 2016 Lisa released Break-ups and Breakthroughs, thus adding to her collection of writing achievements. Lisa is also a regular contributor to the Huffington Post and has her own section on Telstra’s Smarter Business Ideas online.

Lisa has been a regular commentator on business, entrepreneurialism and property and has sat on a number of boards including the Australian Businesswomen’s Network and Publishers Australia.

Her passion is to challenge individuals and corporations to change the way they think, take them out of their comfort zone and prove that there is more than one way to do anything. She encourages entrepreneurial spirit, creativity and innovation and lives life to the absolute max. With fans including Sir Richard Branson, New York Times Best-selling author Bradley Trevor Grieve, and a social media following of well over 100,000, Lisa’s vision is to build a community of likeminded people who want to change the world.

jobs.description:
Lisa launched Collective Hub in 2013 as a print magazine in 37 countries, but it quickly became a global sensation.

Today, it has evolved into a true multimedia brand that encompasses engaging digital content, bespoke events, strategic collaborations and unique product extensions.

Across it all, Collective Hub‘s vision is to uplift and empower people to live their lives to the fullest.

Combining style and substance with a fresh perspective on the issues that matter most, Collective Hub covers business, design, technology, social change, fashion, travel, food, film and art.

Messenger Publishing is a creative and innovative consultancy that thrives on lateral thinking to create out of the box solutions for our clients.  We are never limited by conventions and traditional approaches and love to push comfort zones and invoke attitudinal shift to make extraordinary things happen.  
Our mission is to make the dreams and goals of our clients come alive. We are passionate about having fun and letting our imaginations soar beyond predictable solutions, demonstrating that there is always more than one way to do anything.  

Our unique publishing model is based on funding and distribution partners and is a result of our years not in the publishing industry but in the world of marketing, sponsorship and strategic alliances.  This model enables corporates and individuals to produce books that can become a credible, lasting extension of your brand, an integral part of your existing marketing mix and an additional source of revenue.

Unique, innovative strategic marketing solutions that will take you beyond your
      comfort zone and change the way you think! Specialities around events, sponsorship,
      
      PR, publishing, strategic alliances and anything off the wall.

Here at The Messenger Group, we focus on content creation and strategic engagement by syncing our custom publishing model with our thirst for social media strategies.

Ironically our name says it all (coincidentally our founder and creative director shares the same surname). What we do is actually quite simple.

We translate messages – strategically and creatively.
Our unique non-traditional funding and distribution models have allowed us to dominate the corporate sales market and flip the publishing industry on its head.

While our core focus is producing books and magazines as an extension of brand and as a marketing tool, we also specialise in content creation, branding, design and marketing solutions.

We strongly believe that no good idea should be abandoned and that there’s never only one way to do something.

general.headline: Co-founder and CEO at Afterpay
general.description:
Nick Molnar is a serial entrepreneur with extensive experience in online retail. Nick is co-founder and CEO of Afterpay Holdings Ltd, a leading Australian retail payments innovator and one of Australia’s fastest growing fintech companies. Afterpay facilitates commerce between retail merchants and their end-customers - offering a ‘buy now, take now, pay later’ service that does not require end-customers to enter into a traditional loan or pay any upfront fees or interest to Afterpay. Afterpay currently has over 1.5+ million customers and over 14,000+ retail merchants. Afterpay listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in May 2016. 

Prior to establishing Afterpay, Nick launched the leading American online jeweller, Ice.com, into Australia under the local brand Iceonline.com.au. Given Nick’s family has been in the Australian jewellery industry for the past 30 years, he was able to combine specialised local product knowledge with technical online marketing expertise to exploit on the gap in the market. Nick successfully grew Ice in Australia to become the largest online-only jewellery and watch retailer. 

Nick has worked as an Investment Analyst at venture capital fund M. H. Carnegie & Co., where he was primarily responsible for growth stage investments.

jobs.description:
Afterpay is the new way for Australians to pay. Our easy-to-use payment process allows shoppers to buy their product today and pay it off in 4 equal fortnightly instalments. Afterpay believes in evolving the retail status quo to provide customers a better way to shop.  Through Australian innovation, Afterpay has evolved layby enabling shoppers to buy more of what they love, more often. Launched in 2014, Afterpay floated on the Australian Stock Exchange in May 2016 and partners with hundreds of Australia’s leading retailers such as Myer, The Iconic, Officeworks, Big W, General Pants, Glue, Topshop and Toys R Us to name a few. We're excited to now be available both online and in-store. Visit Afterpay.com.au for more information.
Afterpay was awarded “FinTech Innovator in Payments” at the inaugural FinTech Awards 2016.

America's largest online jewellery retailer has arrived in Australia with over 1,500
      
      fashion leading products - www.iceonline.com.au

Started in 2008 by selling excess jewellery inventory on eBay while at university. In 2011/12 BeShop became Australia's largest store in Jewellery and Watches category.

In April 2012, BeShop joined M. H. Carnegie & Co.'s incubator program. In November 2012, BeShop evolved into Australia's largest online jewellery retailer www.iceonline.com.au

M. H. Carnegie & Co. Pty Ltd is a private equity, venture capital and advisory firm established by Mark Carnegie in 2010. Mark Carnegie has been investing in, managing and advising on both public and private market investments for almost 30 years. The M. H. Carnegie & Co. team consists of talented professional investors, fund managers, advisors and entrepreneurs. Together with Carnegie Venture Capital Pty Ltd, the ultimate General Partner of the Carnegie Innovation Fund, LP, M. H. Carnegie & Co. manages direct investments on behalf of institutional, wholesale and high net worth investors with approximately A$200 million in committed capital across several funds.

general.headline: Founder & Director at Lyons Property Mentoring
general.description:
Despite being quite the traveller and adrenaline junkie, Gennavieve’s main passion has always been property and investing. After graduating high school, she worked three jobs, seven days a week, until buying her first house at 18. By 21, Gennavieve had properties in 3 countries, and the rest is history!

Gennavieve holds several qualifications, including Certificates in Business, Management, Life Coaching and a Bachelor's degree in Journalism, which she put to good use as a News Reader with several Queensland radio stations before moving to Perth.

Despite loving life in radio, at the end of the day it was still a job she was required to attend, day in day out, and (as you will come to learn) the thought of that has never sat right with her – her job was restricting her time and financial ability to give back to the world.

Upon moving to Perth, she made the conscious decision to step away from Journalism. Instead, spending almost every dollar and waking hour gaining a solid financial education and reigniting her love for property.

Now, as an active Australian & International property investor, Gennavieve spends her time traveling, predominantly split between Australia and America, where she ‘flips properties’ for fun, giving her the freedom she was after to help and educate others to live a life on their terms as well.

It is Gennavieve’s thirst for learning and watching others achieve that ‘light bulb’ moment that lead her to this point and the creation of Lyons Property Mentoring. With clients and subscribers coming from all walks of life, with amazing stories, knowledge and experience.

For those who are looking to gain something extra from their lives, Gennavieve is always more than happy to share her journey with you in the hope of bringing some inspiration (or humour, there’s been a lot of mistakes!) to your day, but more importantly to help you progress towards your own ‘Why’. Don’t be a stranger, we would love to hear from you!

jobs.description:
Lyons Property Mentoring is first and foremost an education platform. Providing enlightenment around both property investing and personal mindset; with the mission of giving as many people as possible that ‘light bulb moment’ and show you that a life of abundance IS absolutely possible!

If you, like Gennavieve, know what you want to achieve and are super passionate about the big goals you’ve set for yourself, but can’t seem to find the right people to assist you on your journey, it’s time to EDUCATE YOURSELF!

There is a massive lack of unbiased, well-rounded education available to the everyday Australian, which as a result gives people the impression that investing is difficult or out of reach. There was a need for people to be TAUGHT ABOUT INVESTING, BY AN ACTIVE INVESTOR, that covers not just where and how to buy property, but how to get through life as an investor- how to train your mindset to handle the ups and downs and live a life most people can’t get their head around because they are taught to be a slave to the system.

We’re proud to say that today, we have created just that with Lyons Property Mentoring’s Training Ring! We become partners on your personal journey to ACHIEVING YOUR FINANCIAL AND LIFESTYLE GOALS, with everything you need to know presented in easy to understand, weekly online trainings for you to access at your own convenience.

When you subscribe to this exclusive members’ area, in addition to the weekly training you get FREE access to The Lyons Den, our investor community hangout, where all of our members get to share their stories, ask questions and support, celebrate and motivate each other. 

Because we are client focused, being a member means you also have the privilege of REQUESTING TOPICS to be covered in the weekly trainings! So if there is something you want clarification on, we will do our best to incorporate that into your training!

A lack of education is no longer an excuse. See you in the Training Ring!

Radio Personality on 93.9 Hitz FM, Kix FM and 4BU

Morning News Reader/Journalist
Daily promotional 'Hit Machine' crossovers - Broadcasting live from various locations
'Community Switch' - Regular segment on local events
Stand in Breakfast Radio Host

Deputy is a product-led employee management tool, using innovative cloud-based technology, machine learning and A.I, helping businesses transform operations and empowering employees to work the way they want. 

Deputy is a product-led organisation, using innovative cloud-based technology, machine learning and A.I, headquartered in Australia, and growing rapidly across America, APAC and EMEA

Ranked Deloitte's #25 Fastest Growing Technology Startups in Australia 2017, and have raised $25M Series A Round from OpenView Venture Partners.

Hourly paid workers make up 60% of the global workforce, so we are looking for the most talented people to help us achieve our mission - to see every shift in the world rostered on Deputy!

I was the Lead Technical Talent Acquisition Specialist at Adslot. I recruited for our teams in Sydney, Melbourne, New York and Munich. 

Reporting to the Chief Talent Officer, I was the Team Leader of one other Recruiter and managed the recruitment function end to end. I was responsible for devising and executing Adslot's recruitment strategy. I worked closely with the Marketing team on branding for our new website launch. I also organised and hosted Meetups for .NET Developers at Adslot's Sydney office.

I recruited great C#/.NET Developers, .NET Technical Architects (Sydney office), Javascript full stack developers - NodeJS, Express, Jade (Melbourne office), Javascript front-end developers (React, Angular, CoffeeScript), Database Developers, Data Scientists, UX/UI Designers,  QA Testers, Product Managers/Owners, DevOps Engineers, Infrastructure Engineers, and other technical skill sets.

Adslot is the first and only solution to bring together supply and demand at scale into a single trading platform for premium digital media.

The technology we build enables buyers and sellers to trade with an unrivalled level of control, transparency and efficiency. Through automation, we drive down the cost of transaction. Through data, we unlock human intelligence to make better decisions and drive better outcomes.

Adslot is a publicly listed company on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX:ADJ). With offices in New York, London, Shanghai, Munich, Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland, we service market-leading Publishers, Agencies and Advertisers all over the world.

We build, design, test and refine so that thousands of people worldwide can plan, buy and sell billions of digital media dollars seamlessly and easily. 

Together we’re changing the way digital media is bought and sold. Awesome day job if you ask us!

jobs.description:
Hi we’re affix.  

We’re leading the way for positive change in the recruitment market, taking a game changing approach to partnering with our customers.

We’ve based our success on your success

We believe that traditional fee models don’t always lead to the best recruitment outcomes for candidates or employers.

We wanted a stronger guarantee that your career will remain in everyone’s best interest – yours, your employers and ours – well after your appointment to the job.

So we picked it up, thought it over and changed it.

Our fee model means we only get paid if we have done our job right and you remain in your role for the long-term. A simple change which transforms the entire recruitment process from beginning to end to focus on a single goal. Your career.

I led the digital recruitment team at Applause IT; specialising in working with digital agencies, e-commerce houses, software houses and exciting technology start ups across Northwest of England, including - Manchester, Liverpool, Preston, Macclesfield, Stockport & Chester.

With so many recruiters in the market today, all effectively offering the same thing; I understand how hard it can be to find a recruiter you can trust... Fortunately, I have 75+ positive recommendations from current clients and candidates I have helped find new roles. 

So if you're looking for a "Specialist IT Recruiter" with a strong track record in delivering "RESULTS" please connect with me today...

> IT Recruitment Manchester, Digital Recruitment, IT Recruitment Liverpool, Recruitment North West

Consult Solutions is a UK recruitment consultancy that specialise in the provision of
      
      Information Technology, Senior Appointments and Finance professionals.

jobs.description:
We know recruitment has a bad rep… Believe us! Here at affix, we're purposefully different and don't work like any other recruiters in Australia. We're passionate about partnering with inspiring tech startups and leading employers who challenge the status quo and innovate via technology. 

Recruitment doesn't need 'Disruption', it needs to be done Better!" We are leading the #RecruitmentRevolution and we believe that traditional fee models don’t always lead to the best recruitment outcomes for candidates or employers. 

We wanted a stronger guarantee that the decision you make meets everyone’s best interest. So we picked it up, thought it over and changed it.

Our fee model means we only get paid if we have done our job right and your new recruit remains in their role for 12 months and beyond. A simple change which transforms the entire recruitment process from beginning to end to focus on a single goal – getting the right person for your business without killing cash flow and ensuring they find their #HappyPlaceatWork.

We aren't driven by KPI's, but we ARE driven by passion! Everyone says they are different to everyone else. Want to know how we live up to that statement? Just ask me

UGL Limited is a broad based infrastructure services company engaged in industrial maintenance, manufacturing, engineering and business process outsourcing services for blue-chip companies and governments throughout Australia, New Zealand, Asia, North America and parts of the Middle East.

Listed on the Australian Stock Exchange under the code UGL.

UGL services a broad range of industry sectors through its four operating businesses:

UGL Infrastructure is a multi-service business offering construction, engineering, operational and maintenance services to the water, power, communications road & rail transport and defence industries.

UGL Rail offers customers in the rail sector a fully integrated solution including the design, engineering, manufacture, maintenance, refurbishment and asset management of locomotives, passenger cars, trams, and freight wagons.

UGL Resources provides asset management, construction and project management, engineering, industrial maintenance and manufacturing services to customers in the resources sector, including oil and gas, petrochemicals minerals and chemicals. 

UGL Services is a leading premier global provider of outsourcing services including corporate real estate, facilities management, procurement, human resources, and finance and accounting.
